newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks in London little changed, quiet.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks in London little changed, quiet.

text.p: Hong Kong shares were barely changed in quiet London business on Tuesday with most stocks trading around their closes, dealers said.
"There hasn't been much movement all day," said one trader. "Except for Hong Kong Bank, which is a touch better."
HSBC Holdings was quoted at HK$134.65 after closing in Hong Kong at HK$134.5.
The Hang Seng London Reference Index was up just 3.82 points at 11,342.75 by 1346 GMT.
"There's no real direction," one dealer said.
In Hong Kong on Tuesday, interest rate worries dragged the Hang Seng 86-points lower to 11,338.93.
"If the (U.S.) long bond rally holds and the (Wall) Street is better then it will be reflected in what Hong Kong does tomorrow," a trader said.
The 30-year U.S. Treasury bond at 1357 GMT was yielding 6.96 percent. U.S. bond yields were pushed above the 7.0 percent level for the first time in almost a month on Monday.
Elsewhere dealers said August index futures were unlikely to give direction as they were nearing expiry and prices were volatile. Hang Seng index futures closed 93-points lower on Tuesday at 11,285.
